publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2339# Elaine Smith: Violence Against Women - 16 Days Campaign 2001, 25 November - 10 December 2001-That the Parliament congratulates and supports the Scottish women's groups organising activities for the 16 Days Campaign 2001 which highlights the issue of violence against women as a world-wide human rights issue and aims to mobilise women as a social force, building an international women's movement to demand women's rights in this context; notes that over the 16 day period of the campaign its international nature will be promoted with the theme "Think Global - Act Local", and further notes that flags from 14 different countries will be displayed with relevant facts and statistics on violence against women outside the Parliament on the morning of the campaign launch date, 25 November 2001.
S1M-2339# Violence Against Women - 16 Days Campaign 2001, 25 November - 10 December 2001 (lodged on 22 October 2001) Fiona McLeod*, Cathy Jamieson*
